intro: Nasturtium ovirense, commonly known as the swamp nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas in South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and bright orange or yellow flowers. The plant thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found near streams or in marshy habitats. Its flowers are edible, with a peppery taste similar to watercress, and it is sometimes used in culinary applications. The plant also plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
